statements.name: PROC SVMACHINE
statements.description: The SVMACHINE procedure implements support vector machines (SVM) algorithms in SAS Viya. The SVM algorithms include support vector classification (SVC) and support vector regression (SVR). As a popular data mining model, SVM algorithms compute support vector machine learning classifiers for the binary pattern recognition problem and regression problem. Like other predictive modeling tools, the SVMACHINE procedure uses input data to train a model and provides information about the model. The procedure executes an SVM algorithm (by applying the interior point optimization method, the coordinate descent optimization method, or the active-set optimization method during training) and can generate a SAS analytic store for scoring future data.
statements.help:
PROC SVMACHINE <options>;                 
	AUTOTUNE <options>;                 
	CODE  FILE=filename;                 
	CROSSVALIDATION <options>;                 
	FREQ  variable;                 
	ID variables;                 
	INPUT  variables / <LEVEL=INTERVAL | NOMINAL>;                 
	KERNEL  kernel-type / <kernel-parameter>;                 
	OUTPUT  OUT=mylib.data-table<option>;                 
	PARTITION  partition-option;                 
	SAVESTATE  RSTORE=mylib.data-table;                 
	TARGET  variable </options>;                 
	WEIGHT  variable;

arguments.name: APPLYROWORDER
arguments.description: uses a data distribution and row order as determined by a previous partition action call

arguments.name: C=
arguments.description: specifies the penalty value, where number is a real number greater than 0

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC SVMACHINE to use

arguments.name: EARLYSTOP
arguments.description: generates a model that is based on the validation accuracy

arguments.name: EPSILON=
arguments.description: specifies the insensitive loss value, where number is a nonnegative real number

arguments.name: ITERATIONREPORT
arguments.description: generates a table named "Iteration Report," which displays the training accuracy for each iteration

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations before the process stops, where number is a positive integer

arguments.name: MAXSV=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of support vectors, where number is a positive integer

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the optimization method to use for training the data

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses the generation of ODS outputs

arguments.name: NOSCALE
arguments.description: uses the original data during training

arguments.name: NTHREADS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of threads to use in the computation

arguments.name: PRINTTARGET
arguments.description: generates the "Predicted Probability Variables" table, which displays the target variable and the predicted probability variables, and the "Predicted Target Variable" table, which displays the predicted target variable

arguments.name: REGL1=
arguments.description: specifies the L1 penalty value when METHOD=CD, where number is a real number greater than 0

arguments.name: REGL2=
arguments.description: specifies the L2 penalty value when METHOD=CD, where number is a real number greater than 0

arguments.name: SCALE
arguments.description: scales the input variables to between 0 and 1 during training

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies the random number seed when METHOD=CD, where number is a nonnegative integer

arguments.name: TOLERANCE=
arguments.description: specifies the minimal absolute tolerance at which the iteration stops

arguments.name: USEMISS
arguments.description: uses missing values for input variables

statements.name: AUTOTUNE
statements.description: searches for the best combination of values of the C= option in the PROC SVMACHINE statement and the {DEGREE=} suboption of the POLYNOMIAL option in the KERNEL statement

arguments.name: TUNINGPARAMETERS=
arguments.description: specifies which options to tune and which ranges to tune over

arguments.name: C
arguments.description: specifies the penalty values to be used when tuning the SVM model, where number or any value in value-list is a real number greater than 0

arguments.name: LB=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum penalty value to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: UB=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum penalty value to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: VALUES=
arguments.description: specifies a list of penalty values to consider when tuning the SVM model, where value-list is a space-separated list of numbers greater than 0

arguments.name: INIT=
arguments.description: specifies the initial penalty value for the tuner to use

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: excludes the penalty suboption from the tuning process

arguments.name: DEGREE
arguments.description: specifies the degree that is used in a polynomial kernel when tuning the SVM model, where number and values in the value-list can be 2 or 3

arguments.name: LB=
arguments.description: specifies a lower bound of the degree to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: UB=
arguments.description: specifies an upper bound of the degree to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: VALUES=
arguments.description: specifies a list of values to consider for the degree in the kernel, where value-list is a space-separated list of numbers

arguments.name: INIT=
arguments.description: specifies the initial degree of the kernel in the SVM model

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: excludes the degree from the tuning process

arguments.name: KERNEL_METHOD
arguments.description: specifies the combined values of the KERNEL and METHOD suboptions that are used when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: VALUES=
arguments.description: specifies a list of values to consider for the KERNEL_METHOD suboption, where value-list is a space-separated list of strings

arguments.name: INIT=
arguments.description: specifies the initial value of the KERNEL_METHOD suboption

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: excludes the KERNEL_METHOD suboption from the tuning process

arguments.name: RBFPARAMETER
arguments.description: specifies the RBFPARAMETER (K_PAR) suboption values to be used when tuning the SVM model, where number or any value in the value-list is a real number greater than 0

arguments.name: LB=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum RBFPARAMETER suboption value to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: UB=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum RBFPARAMETER suboption value to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: VALUES=
arguments.description: specifies a list of RBFPARAMETER suboption values to consider when tuning the SVM model, where value-list is a space-separated list of numbers greater than 0

arguments.name: INIT=
arguments.description: specifies the initial RBFPARAMETER suboption value for the tuner to use

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: excludes the RBFPARAMETER suboption from the tuning process

arguments.name: REGL2
arguments.description: specifies the REGL2 suboption values to be used when tuning the SVM model, where number or any value in the value-list is a real number greater than 0

arguments.name: LB=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum REGL2 suboption value to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: UB=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum REGL2 suboption value to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: VALUES=
arguments.description: specifies a list of REGL2 suboption values to consider when tuning the SVM model, where value-list is a space-separated list of numbers greater than 0

arguments.name: INIT=
arguments.description: specifies the initial REGL2 suboption value for the tuner to use

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: excludes the REGL2 suboption from the tuning process

arguments.name: SIGMOIDPARAMETER1
arguments.description: specifies the SIGMOIDPARAMETER1 (K_PAR1) suboption values to be used when tuning the SVM model, where number or any value in the value-list is a real number greater than 0

arguments.name: LB=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum SIGMOIDPARAMETER1 suboption value to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: UB=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum SIGMOIDPARAMETER1 suboption value to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: VALUES=
arguments.description: specifies a list of SIGMOIDPARAMETER1 suboption values to consider when tuning the SVM model, where value-list is a space-separated list of numbers greater than 0

arguments.name: INIT=
arguments.description: specifies the initial SIGMOIDPARAMETER1 suboption value for the tuner to use

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: excludes the SIGMOIDPARAMETER1 suboption from the tuning process

arguments.name: SIGMOIDPARAMETER2
arguments.description: specifies the SIGMOIDPARAMETER2 (K_PAR2) suboption values to be used when tuning the SVM model, where number or any value in the value-list is a real number

arguments.name: LB=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum SIGMOIDPARAMETER2 suboption value to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: UB=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum SIGMOIDPARAMETER2 suboption value to consider when tuning the SVM model

arguments.name: VALUES=
arguments.description: specifies a list of SIGMOIDPARAMETER2 suboption values to consider when tuning the SVM model, where value-list is a space-separated list of real numbers

arguments.name: INIT=
arguments.description: specifies the initial SIGMOIDPARAMETER2 suboption value for the tuner to use

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: excludes the SIGMOIDPARAMETER2 suboption from the tuning process

statements.name: CODE
statements.description: generates SAS DATA step code that mimics the computations that the OUTPUT statement performs

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the file to write the SAS score code to

statements.name: CROSSVALIDATION
statements.description: performs k-fold cross validation to find the average estimated validation error

arguments.name: KFOLD=
arguments.description: specifies the number of partition folds in the cross validation process, where number is between 2 and 20, inclusive

arguments.name: NOPARALLEL
arguments.description: specifies that k-fold cross validation not be run in parallel

arguments.name: NSUBSESSIONWORKERS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of worker nodes to use in parallel subsessions

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: identifies a numeric variable in the input data table that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation

statements.name: ID
statements.description: lists one or more variables that are to be copied from the input data table to the output data tables that are specified in the OUT= option in the OUTPUT statement and the RSTORE= option in the SAVESTATE statement

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: specifies the names of variables to be used in training

arguments.name: LEVEL=
arguments.description: specifies whether the specified input variables are continuous or categorical

statements.name: KERNEL
statements.description: specifies the type of kernel and any associated parameters to be used during training

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: uses a linear kernel during training

arguments.name: POLYNOMIAL
arguments.description: uses a polynomial kernel during training

arguments.name: RBF
arguments.description: uses a radial basis function (RBF) kernel during training

arguments.name: SIGMOID
arguments.description: uses a sigmoid kernel during training

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: creates an output data table that contains the predicted values of the input data table

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data table for PROC SVMACHINE to use

arguments.name: COPYVAR=
arguments.description: lists one or more variables from the input data table that are transferred to the output data table

arguments.name: ROLE
arguments.description: specifies a numeric variable that indicates the role that each observation plays in fitting the model

statements.name: PARTITION
statements.description: specifies how observations in the input data set are logically partitioned into disjoint subsets for model training, validation, and testing

arguments.name: FRACTION
arguments.description: randomly assigns specified proportions of the observations in the input data table to the roles

arguments.name: ROLE=
arguments.description: names the variable in the input data table whose values are used to assign roles to each observation

statements.name: SAVESTATE
statements.description: creates an analytic store for the model and saves it as a binary object in a data table

arguments.name: RSTORE=
arguments.description: specifies a data table in which to save the analytic store for the model

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: names the target variable whose values PROC SVMACHINE predicts

arguments.name: LEVEL=
arguments.description: specifies whether the specified target is continuous or categorical

arguments.name: ASC
arguments.description: levelizes the target values in ascending order

arguments.name: DESC
arguments.description: levelizes the target values in descending order

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: variable is used to weight each observation to perform a weighted analysis of the data
